page.title: 19RECREATION
page.content: On Sunday at l.l5 I went riding at a riding school in Abbey Road. We did trotting in a paddock then after about l5 minutes we went round Carr Road and my stirrup came off when "Mouse" jumped a puddle! I had to have my pony tied up to a horse because I'm only a learner. It was only my first day with Victoria and Beth who said I was good for my first time. It cost Â£2.7O per hour. My Mum said that it isn't worth it. When we got to the railway station it started raining and I got soaked because I hadn't got my hood on. We got to a field where we had to leave the horses and then we went home. I walked so far with Carolyn Robinson and I walked the rest of the way on my own. When I got home I had to change my clothes, I put a dress on and my old shoes. It had stopped raining and Bernadette came.
